job_title: Instructor of History in Nevada, MO
pros: I’ve taught at SIAS on two separate occasions during sabbaticals from my US college. Both times I enjoyed working in a supportive environment and formed lasting ties with Chinese students and fellow teachers. The expat leadership helped navigate cultural differences, provided useful training and constructive advice, and were ready to help, when needed. SIAS provides room and board and optional cultural outings (which I’m glad I took advantage of. Both times I also took the free Chinese language courses and loved our friendly and patient teachers.
cons: The internet was sometimes frustrating. Sometimes Chinese administrators set policies that didn’t seem reasonable, but the expat leadership team always worked with teachers to adapt as needed.

pros: Soft landing in China. Friendly people. Beautiful campus.
cons: Very low pay. deteriorating situation for foreigners, diminishing benefits, a lot of unqualified foreign teachers, increasing bureaucracy without input from regular employees.

pros: I learned a lot of thing from my coworkers and the managers when I was an intern there and I still miss there. Easy environment.
cons: Maybe a little bit dull working there, won't hurt to add some team-built activities.
